column4: is it possible to change window managers without restarting X?
..i don't want to! i should be able to do that from inside the current running X
gnome should have a "log out" button
don't want to log out..i should get a menu with a choice of WM's and i should be able to pick one to use and it shoudl automatically change to it..s'what every other distro has...
oh, you mean you want enlightened gnome?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=54476&highlight=enlightened+gnome+ultimate+eyecandy
#enlightenment
nobody home
oh.
this channel is all volunteers

this is free software you're using. it's nobody's *responsibility* to answer to you. if somebody helps you, it's because they know how and *feel like it*. this isn't big business, and there is no market share
this channel is made up of volunteers, not paid tech support staff. you *can* pay for tech support if you want, but this isn't the place for that
i didn't say it was..all i was getting at is, just because it isn't directly a ubuntu issue, doesn't mean you can't try to offer some help..
i've been using linux for a few years now, and i have always appreciated every bit of help i get
if there isn't anybody who happens to know the solution, you may feel ignored.
ah, sweet then
i mean, the reason i won't help you isn't out of spite, it's just that i used enlightenment for exactly one day and the quit
no no..if no one know then no one knows..that's alright..but turning me away simply because it's not directly a ubuntu issue is a bit rude..just say you don't know..s'all i ask
so i don't know
sorry
i was only trying to direct you to a spot where people would be more likely to know :-/
don't be sorry, you didn't do anything wrong
yes..YOU tried to help. Jack_Sparrow simply said it's not a ubuntu issue..which i do not appreciate..atleast say you don't know
